Reviews.Title: “awful experience !!!!”
Reviews.Author: Erica H
Reviews.Content: I have been trying to resolve my issue since the fall and no resoultion. The hotel is nice however the level of customer service is awful. I was switch to 4 different rooms with-in 2 hours. The first room had a red stain on the floor, 2nd room power went out , 3rd room another guest was taking a shower and finally a good room. After reaching out to the hotel i was told there would be no comps at all.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: EAOI82
Reviews.Content: I was there for business and it was a comfortable stay and easy to get to various locations from this point. The staff members i encountered were all quite helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Location not ideal for tourism but good for business trip. Not worth the price.”
Reviews.Author: Ajm4
Reviews.Content: My partner and I booked a vacation package from Miami to Cancun and stayed downtown Miami for 3 days before and on Miami Beach for 2 days after our Cancun trip to see both sides of the city. We loved Miami Beach much more than Miami itself!! So much livelier! A lot of this had to do with the location of this hotel. The hotel is in the Financial District so the streets were bare every time we were on them as there is no retail etc just offices in this area. There was a nice little intersection with some nice restaurants on it a quick walk away but other than that we felt like we were an awkward distance from things. Too close to take a cab but just far enough that it was a long walk. This is solved by the free metro line the hotel is very close to which can get you out of the area....but its never nice to stay in an area you cant wait to get out of all day and night. The room: The rooms were ok. Nothing special. Bed was veery comfy but the room was muggy and very average. We had a lot of problems exchanging money in Miami since our hotel was not only not near anything that could help us with this typical tourist practice (odd since it's in the financial district), but also because the staff could not and would not try to name a place we could cab/walk to do this. In contrast, we went by the Holiday Inn on Bayside across from the market to ask them where a money exchange place was nearby since they were the closest hotel to us at that moment and we thought they might know how to answer this touristy question (I always pop into nearby hotels when I am out of town if I have questions about the city as the day goes on since they are in the tourism business so always know the answers and are always ready to court new guests). The cheaper Holiday Inn helped us despite us not being guests and pointed us to the nearby Western Union (Miami tip: exchange all of your money before going it was a real headache exchanging it there for some reason). All in all, the much less prestigious Holiday Inn seemed to be just as clean and comfortable with better service and a much better location for tourism (by the Arena, Bayside Marketplace, and the bridge to Miami Beach) and I imagine it would have cost a lot less... This hotel is well suited for business trips but not worth the price or travel time for a tourism trip. Maybe if it were super nice it would make it worth the poor location but alas it is not...it is average.

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel....”
Reviews.Author: AlexanderDelarge
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my recent stay in the JW Marriott Miami. The staff was friendly and the rooms were very cozy. The bed was comfortable though the pillows were too soft for me. The hotel is located in a nice area that offers several options for dining. The rooms are not cheap and the hotel is geared more for business than family stays. Overall, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “In the Brickell, but a business hotel at heart.”
Reviews.Author: CarinaJean
Reviews.Content: Booked hotel through the cruise company, for one night before my cruise. It was the Friday night before the Miami Marathon and the Brickell was hopping. But don't be fooled. The JW Marriott is a business hotel catering to conferences and the like. There wasn't even a coffee shop on premises, and the place literally died on Saturday. The front desk and concierge were very helpful in finding me a fun place to hang out. In that regard, the hotel is very close to lots of restaurants and bars and shopping. So, I did like the location a great deal. My room was great. Very inviting, upscale decor and furnishings. Lovely pillows and quiet (did I mention the hotel was dead) The bathroom was great with lots of extras. Very luxurious. The towels could have been a little thicker, given how beautiful the bathroom is. Didn't check out the dining area and walked over to Starbucks for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Tired, but handy for business trips”
Reviews.Author: Dodge51
Reviews.Content: Of Marriott standard but at the tired end of their portfolio. The dullness of the interior jars with the vibrancy and brightness of the Florida setting. Although perfectly situated for business meetings in Brickell, I would definitely chose one of the many other hotels in the area if on vacation. Pretty pricey this place too. It scrapes a 3 rating because I loved their lobby muzak soundtrack which included Arcade Fire, Coldplay, REM. A refreshing change!

Reviews.Title: “Consistent with Marriott luxury”
Reviews.Author: mukhi
Reviews.Content: We had a generally fine stay at the JW. The bathroom is large, and the room was clean with a view of the pool. There's a good size gym and the hotel provides lots of complementary bottled water. The neighborhood is nice to walk around with some restaurants and bars although it's mostly office buildings. The in-room Wi-Fi did not work well, but they have cat-5 jacks. The pool is on the 19th floor and there are hot tubs along side. Along the wall one can see a sliver Biscayne Bay, which is a short walk down the road.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, not much else...”
Reviews.Author: Caronrick
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a weekend trip with a couple of friends. The Staff from start to finish were absolutely amazing. If not for them the rating would be much lower. Only thing they missed was telling me you need the room key to activate the elevator.. took a couple of trips up and down until I figured that one out.. The location is pretty good. Walking distance to some great restaurants and bars and the inner-city rail line to get around the downtown core. The room... overall basic.. the internet didn't work the whole time I was there no matter what was done to fix it. The room looked worn and dated. Bed was only moderately comfortable. Bathroom was nice and spacious. Quite large for a hotel bathroom really.. but the finish work on the shower was definitely sub-par for the Marriott name.. one tile on the tub surround right where you enter/exit was not installed properly and stuck out about 1/4".. Quite easy to catch yourself on the corner.. Overall I would not return unless I received a fantastic rate, and even then, there are much better options in my opinion that I really wouldn't return.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property But Faulty Furniture”
Reviews.Author: colorations
Reviews.Content: I used 30,000 points to reserve a room for an overnight stay pre-cruise. A really beautiful room, well appointed with a lovely bay view. It's within walking distance to Bayside Market which is a great place to walk along the river, see nice boats and have a drink and dinner. This area is adjacent to American Airlines Arena ie; Miami Heat play here. Unfortunately, my stay was marred by a mishap in the bathroom. The hassock had 2 legs loose and I fell to the tile floor. What could have easily been a serious incident, was fortunately just a bruised arm and a sore back, but hardly how I wanted to begin my vacation. In addition, the blow dryer smoked when turned on and the bed had a huge crater in the middle which made sleeping well impossible. All of this was addressed at the front desk upon check out. They comped us lunch for our trouble and promised the manager would follow up with me regarding the fall. I did receive an email from the assistant manager but their compensation offered was wholly inadequate. I'm still waiting on their reply to my reply. If you stay here, just watch out for those small legs on the hassocks in the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous - we will be back”
Reviews.Author: leanbureaucrat
Reviews.Content: The best JW Marriott that I have ever been to - our room was on the 32nd floor, overlooking Key Biscayne. Modern & high-tech room, with a TV in the bathroom mirror. Very nice location - close to the miami river which has a nice river boardwalk. The outdoor pool on the 19th floor is a must try. Very courteous staff. We will definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Ajram
Reviews.Content: Booked hotel for Miami Marathon - Nice and clean! Hotel is close to Mary Brickell Square (Great place to relax and meet the locals).

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean hotel but call a cab yourself”
Reviews.Author: momee3021
Reviews.Content: 1 night stay but the room was comfortable the pool was one of the best I've ever been in - outdoor, heated and a Steele bottom. They don't tell you that you have to insert you key in the elevator to go to any floor a lot of confused guests. The only downside is if you need a cab one is never available. Very strange since every hotel I've ever been to - cabs are there waiting. We waiting 40 minutes for a cab which is a pain. Nice stay would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in downtown Miami”
Reviews.Author: nytraveler86
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 1 night after returning from a cruise. The hotel was very quiet as it was MLK Day and it is located in an area which people probably stay primarily for business. We were able to check in early and because of status (and probably because they appeared pretty empty) were upgraded to a two room suite with a balcony. The room was great with two large tv's, a bose sound system and an espresso maker. All rooms come with an in-room computer which is nice to have even when most people now probably travel with their laptops. We had lunch in the (casual) hotel restaurant and the food was great. The concierge lounge was also well stocked for breakfast and evening stacks. The one downside to the hotel is that there are a bunch of highrise office buildings and apartments that block the sun from reaching the pool for a few hours each day. I also cannot speak well for the price as I used a Marriott certificate but I believe I received very good value for it.

Reviews.Title: “VIP”
Reviews.Author: islamanare
Reviews.Content: IÂ´ve been travelling to Florida for decades but never stayed on this side of the city before. In this case I needed to be close to the banks and commercial area but it turned out to be the best choice made in years. As in every Marriott Hotel, the service was superb, receptionists very polite and helpful, concierge treated us as VIP guests, even when we were not, hotel room was perfect and comfortable. The only downfall would be the internet service which was very slow and there was no wireless service in the room. There was a road construction nearby which interferes with the valet parking access. Closeness to the many bistros and restaurants made this stay well worth repeating.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in Services and overall product”
Reviews.Author: LovinFrankenmuth
Reviews.Content: I don't like rating a Marriott property this low. But the overall package of normal services was sad. The room was appointed nicely, even with a computer. Unfortunately the internet speed to the provided computer was almost as slow as the wireless was to my laptop. Always had a "poor" connection in room 1510. The bathroom was beautiful including a glass door and wall for the tub which is unusual. Unfortunately the glass door would not stay closed so I had to deal with a puddle of water from the shower to avoid slipping - each morning. The wireless was included in the room rate - thank you, but connected at 5 - 10megabyts per second is pitiful. The CFO conference was in their banquet rooms. Never saw a hotel where bathrooms were so remotely located to banqeut rooms. Only hot lunch was beautifully presented but on room temperature plates and was luke warm. Dessert was in hall but not informed of that during lunch. no beverage service at all. Biggest disappointment was that a neti pot (used to clear out sinuses) was removed from my room - probalby by accident. I called the operator on early evening of day two; afternoon of day three, evening of night three and talked to a manager on departure morning. No one took ownership or called back. I had to continue to ask and ask. Final manager made restitution. Finally, it is disgraceful that free wifi is in a conference lobby but not in the banquet rooms. That level of service is either poor or greedy. That is for each person to decide. I unfortunately don't speak spanish, but all waitstaff, housekeepers & hostesses spoke spanish to each other instead of english. Just felt funny that I didn't know what they were talking about with each other next to me - yet in the U.S. - just a little thing... Definitely a pretty place and nice areas to walk to around the hotel. But not likely to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: robfree
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marriott in august with my family i was very pleased with this hotel. It is beautiful , the Drake bar is very nice ! It is very easy drive and we never encountered much traffic. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “service”
Reviews.Author: seopattie b
Reviews.Content: when i called the hotel around 3am to cancel my reservation fredericka and the stupid phone operator didnt know what to do. they both were clueless. being an associate with marriott by there demaeanor and attitude over the phone and of the refusal to help me i would of got fired. they insisted of transfering me to reservations when they authorized my credit card in december of 2011 for a reservation for may of 2012. i think this is unreal and should be able to get my money back. i think that this is sufficent time to cancel without any penalty because they have enough time to sell the room. this hotel being that it is a full service with upscale guests they need to have upscale service and attend to every need. there is something called going over and beyond of excellence which you dont have at this property. i know that associates get a room for a discount but that shouldnt change the service that marriott expects everyone to preform.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in downtown Miami”
Reviews.Author: MainzSleeper
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel in downtown Miami. The rooms are large and have huge new flat panel TVs. Service is excellent. The only problem is that there is not much to do around the hotel. With the exception of Brickell village there are no shops or restaurants. However, the metro station is only two blocks away which brings you to most places in the Miami area. It is great for running along the Bay if you are into running. You could run all the way to Key Biscayne if you want.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: TriniNewYork
Reviews.Content: I cannot fault anything at this hotel. Check in was a breeze with smiles and warmth. Stayed in suite 1106. Superb room with 2 tvs - 50" and 42". Coffee maker and expresso machine in room.Concierge lounge was good but the service was spectacular. The staff at this hotel is truly in a class by themselves. Excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Flags in the room”
Reviews.Author: Seat62A
Reviews.Content: Checking in I was fortunate enough to be upgraded to the Presidential Suite, I can completely and utterly recommend this room. Two balconies, an 8 person dining table, a great seating area and a huge bath. Absolutely a brilliant upgrade result. I've also stayed here in normal rooms and I can say that generally this is one of the nicer hotels in downtown Miami. The gym is good and the pool is great. Really a good hotel as there are lots of nice restaurants in the local area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff and Service”
Reviews.Author: CorncobOBiscuit
Reviews.Content: Amazing service. These two words define my stay. Every staff member I encountered was friendly and greeted me, even maintenance workers passing in the hallway. Any question or request was handled quickly. I once locked myself out of my room safe, and within five minutes, security had it unlocked, free of charge. The one minor exception was when I ordered a wake-up call the first morning, and it was never received. Luckily I had set other alarms, and this was the one minor blemish on an otherwise spectacular trip. The hotel itself is kept extremely clean and polished. I rarely saw a trash receptacle or an ashtray on the property that wasn't empty. My one point of contention is with some of the permanent fixtures in the hotel. Upon arriving, I noticed that many of the brass door handles and knobs were tarnished or missing their coating. Also, one of the curtain pull rods in my room appeared to have torn from it's grommet, and was rigged in place with a curtain hook that had been pinned to the drapes, making it difficult to open the curtains without pulling the rod down. These are fairly minor issues, but given the price tag of the hotel, it seems a bit out of place. However, the rest of the fixtures and amenities both in the room and elsewhere on the property were in line with a luxury brand hotel, as was the service.

Reviews.Title: “Always Our Choice - Almost Always”
Reviews.Author: omegaet
Reviews.Content: Good to be a Lifetime Platinum Marriott Member, so we get upgraded at this hotel. We always make an annual pilgrimage to the South Beach Wine & Food Festival in February, and make this hotel our base of operations, rather than putting up with the hotel rates on Miami Beach....not that the JW is 'giving away" their rooms. A call to the front desk, prior to arrival, general results in fulfillment of our requests for a 'feather-free' room environment (allergic reactions to feather can be such a bummer) We always request, and usually get a bayside vs. street side view...although, as long as we are on or above the 20th floor, we're content. The VIP Lounge is small, usually crowded, but the tables seems to turn at a reasonable pace. Food and snack selections are adequate, but nothing over the top - if it's free, eat it, skip it; but at least don't complain about! â€¢ Love the TVs behind the mirrors in the suites bathrooms (careful not to cut yourself shaving, if Julie Durda, the Metrologists on WSVN Channel 7, is doing the morning weather report - wasn't she a cheerleader for the SF49ers in a prior life). â€¢ Also, can't beat that morning caffeine fix with the ensuite Nespresso machines. We use a Nespresso at home and it's not so easy to find one in most hotels these days. We've even taken to packing our own Nexpresso capsule choices for visit to the JW - a double Indriya is a good way to start the day and at night, a Decaffeinato Lungo is almost as pleasant as a good night kiss! Actually, there are many, many more reason to select this hotel, if this area of Miami is your destination. No need to further elaborate, since you can and should explore on your own. Buenas noches y felices sueÃ±os

Reviews.Title: “A Sea of Calm amongst the glitter...”
Reviews.Author: Mrmojo58
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel. Do not confuse with the "Techno-Hip" Marriott Marquis - the "plain" JW is a classic hotel in town full of "glitter". This place is an Oasis . Walnut- paneled walls & elevators, Traditional rooms & furniture but elegant & refined. I was upgraded to a 2 rm Suite with 2 of the biggest Flat panel tv's I've ever seen in a hotel room! Hotel staff was exceptionally friendly, the restaurant was pleasant & efficient. The Sunday Brunch was "way above average" but the Room Service menu lacked creativity of any kind. The Room Service Staff was OK but the food quality was bland. Valet Parking was unusually prompt. Nice place - no Flash.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean and close to the mall”
Reviews.Author: bellabug2011
Reviews.Content: This hotel was nice and clean. It was a great hotel for a quiet get away by myself. The mall is a short walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel -- Not the Best in Downtown”
Reviews.Author: ducli7
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a nice hotel downtown, this is a great place to stay. The JW Marriott is perfect for someone just looking for a nice bed and little more. There is a pool but it's nothing special. The decor and style of the hotel interior/rooms is a little outdated. There are so many great boutique and modern hotels throughout downtown Miami (even the JW Marriott Marquis) that are the same star rating but much nicer. This hotel does not have floor to ceiling windows like many others downtown and very few rooms have a water view. I have no real complaints as the staff was friendly and welcoming -- but in this price and star range I just didn't feel that it was as nice as it could have been.

Reviews.Title: “Great, clean hotel at a decent price”
Reviews.Author: Sara981
Reviews.Content: Sure, it isn't on the beach, but it's clean, has a beautiful restaurant for breakfast and a great bar for working/eating or hanging out with friends. Beds were fluffy and comfortable. Awesome business center with free printing/internet, which was so nice and I rarely see. The best part about this hotel was the service. The front desk staff was so friendly and went out of their way to make sure we were getting the best rates and threw in free continental breakfast, even. The building has a tropical theme but not cheesy - almost like you're in a resort in Mexico. Would defintely stay here again! TIP- take cab/rental car to South Beach and go to The National Hotel. Pay "Day Rate" - $25 for full access to their gorgeous pool and private beach. They have a bar near pools and also waitstaff on beach. $25 also covers towels, tables and umbrellas. Best deal around!

Reviews.Title: “A little bit of paradise in the middle of a big city.”
Reviews.Author: janiss
Reviews.Content: What a fabulous hotel experience. There is not a better location than Brickell Ave. The service was impeccable and the staff were friendly, warm and extremely professional. The hotel was spotless and the bedding was phenomenal.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, excellent service, better rooms- great pool”
Reviews.Author: R S
Reviews.Content: It not always true what you get, what you pay for. This place in down-town Miami although with street construction, has some issues accessing the property, is definitely a place to stay. I would highly recommend. Down-side-- yes there is a parking fee. However, downtown parking is not free in any city, so why complain.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but not up the the JW standard.”
Reviews.Author: setcarp
Reviews.Content: Was with a large group and this is not the hotel to travel with a group to. Did not feel like the management was very helpful and it trickled down from there. My first impression was when I had to lug my luggage up a flight of stairs to get to the front deck. You can go under the hotel and have fewer steps to lug your luggage up, but the staff would rather watch you struggle out front. There is a small elevator to get you up those stairs in the back, but you have to look for it. The pool was not too bad and the fitness center looked pretty nice. The pool was aluminum lined which was pretty interesting. You had to hunt to find a towel. They were not at the pool when I was there. A few blocks away there is an area that has a bunch of great places to eat and a Publix. There is a great small sushi bar right next to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel, a solid choice”
Reviews.Author: KosmoK
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business meetings that were conducted onsite at the hotel. The staff did a great job supporting our needs and the lunches served were exceptionally good. The hotel is in a good location downtown, there are many restaurant choices within walking distance. The rooms were okay, a bit "tired" though (and I was on the concierge level). Overall, this is a solid choice for a business hotel, I will be back for future meetings!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RondaJS
Reviews.Content: Spent an evening at this hotel on business in early June 2011. This is a very high-end business hotel with all the ammenities and services one would expect. I stayed in a suite and it was fantastic. The service was wonderful and the hotel was quiet. The hotel is in a great location for business and has great dining in and around the hotel. Highly Recommend This Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Spent 5 months there and went back for a vacation”
Reviews.Author: Jdfbu96
Reviews.Content: I happened to be working in Miami for 5 months in 2010, and this was the Hotel that I selected as my homebase. The staff, especially Ornellaia, Luis, and Tatiana at the front desk, as well as Edgar, at the Concierge Lounge, treated me as one of the family, granting all of my requests and even sending me wine and cheese, and other amenities on my last week there. So I returned for my wedding anniversary this past January, and they had not forgotten me. They welcomed me back and sent us an anniversary bottle of champagne. I plan to return in August 2011, to a place that one feels comfortable, at ease, and where the service is impeccable. To me it is my home in Miami now. John David Ferrer

Reviews.Title: “Good option for downtown”
Reviews.Author: Kepster1980
Reviews.Content: Good hotel with loads of nice facilities: pool, gym etc Good location in downtown Miami, but you need a car to get to the beach. Recommended

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel, not the best location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: NachoTraveler
Reviews.Content: upscale feel, attentive staff, but it's in the financial district so make sure you want to stay in that area is the only downfall

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in Brickell”
Reviews.Author: mama4llama
Reviews.Content: I stay here when visiting my daughter and the staff always treats me as a welcomed friend. Our room is bright and cheerful, but really could use the carpet replace. Air conditioning is excellent. Beds are very comfortable and our view of the city is enchanting. It is an easy walk to restaurants and night life, but not in the middle of Mary Brickle center which is about 3 blocks away. I'm not sure I'd like to walk back to it alone at night. Taxis are easy to get, 15 min to SOBE and 25 to the airport

Reviews.Title: “An embarrassment to the JW Marriott Brand”
Reviews.Author: medbacik
Reviews.Content: We had our wedding here and had two very different experiences. The social catering team was exceptional and we were 100% happy with our wedding reception. However, our experience and our families' experience staying at the hotel was a different story. It was horrific, really. The people at the front desk were incredibly rude and incompetent during every interaction we had. My parents and other family members were treated horribly. The room service was disgusting. The experience was so bad that we decided not to stay at another JW Marriott that we had planned to stay at on our honeymoon. We regret suggesting to our wedding guests that they stay here, and we will never stay at this, or any other, JW Marriott again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a holiday hotel for a family of four!”
Reviews.Author: sdjcc
Reviews.Content: We state at this hotel post cruise for one night. We had a fabulous cruise around the Caribbean with Royal Caribbean, unfortunately our travel aent picked this for us as a recommendation. The say after we tried to change but with no luck! This spoiled our holiday. We arrived surprisingly early at 8:30am with the whole day ahead of us. First off the receptionist couldn't help with telling us what time we were being collected the next day for the airport, they said other than the room they had no record of us. We went to the room to drop put luggage off and came back and tried again with a different receptionist. She also didn't know I asked her to ring the transport company for us, but she gave me the number told me todo it! We gave up and asked the concierge lady what was best to visit nearby. We asked about shopping but there was nowhere without travel less than $50 she didn't seem interested in helping really. We set off toward the sea I heard about the Bayside and thought we couldn't be far. We were it was about 20 min walk and we had a lovely pleasant day! Now why couldn't she tell us about it?! We got the Metromover back shv didn't metion that either and once we sussed it it was so easy to use and FREE!! Got bcd tried again with reception, no luck! I rang the no. She gave me from the room but it was for Celebrity Cruises! Tried with them again and they were just no help at all! You get free very, very slow Internet in your room so found RC's no. and rang them. Hotel staff were useless! More interest with their business clients. The pool had a bar and would have been very pleasant to use at the end of our day, but it was shut! So we went to the veranda and got lots of stares because we took the children in. There was a conference on the next day and they were all in there! The room they gave us for 2 adults, 13 & 11 yr old boy & girl was 2 'double' beds - more like 2 three quarter beds they were so small! No TV in the mirror.??? If you want a family holiday or pre/post cruise hotel don't choose this one!

Reviews.Title: “Thank You Alex!”
Reviews.Author: murrd90
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at this Hotel a few times in the past. I think it is well located, in that you can access all of SOBE easily enough, but you're also just far enough removed to keep your sanity. This visit got off to a somewhat shaky start, but then Mr. Alex Blanco, the Front Office Manager, came to our rescue and ensured that we enjoyed the rest of our stay. Alex is a true professional and a credit to Marriott. Thanks Again Alex, The gang of 4 from the 9th floor

Reviews.Title: “Nice business hotel”
Reviews.Author: CitizenDave
Reviews.Content: Rooms very comfortable and well-equipped, excellent wifi coverage, good business location.

Reviews.Title: “Awful service”
Reviews.Author: traveler1007
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a meeting last week and we had the worst experience ever. We were a large party, aroung 150 people and the meeting coordination service was awful. Our meeting executive never showed up in two days, the hotel meeting staff was rude and they even broke into one of the sessions and for no reason they started to yell at me something about the audio as I was presenting. I was astonished to see this kind of service from a Marriott. The food was ok, but they were careless enough to serve as the exact same lunch buffet twice in the same week, just two days apart...incredible. Also, I was expecting a package to be delivered at the hotel, and when it got there they had a huge mess with all the packages and they couldn't even find mine and it turned up stored but not even logged on their records. Overall a bad experience for the business meeting and the stay due to poor service.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel but service is not great”
Reviews.Author: SassyGurl666
Reviews.Content: The food in the restaurant is horrible unless you like raw eggs or shells in your eggs. It took 20 minutes to get toast and another 10 for the butter to arrive. Unbelievable for a hotel of this calibre. Had 3 awful breakfasts and that was enough! Front desk staff is unpleasant and obviously not happy to greet or serve customers. Pool is nice except for the couple in the jacuzzi at 9 pm doing the nasty where any child could have seen. The security guard didn't appear to care.

Reviews.Title: “Very well run, cleanly kept, new hotel.”
Reviews.Author: marisap72
Reviews.Content: The service was impeccable and the hotel was incredibly clean. The location is very safe and nice, just not particularly residential. It is in the middle of every bank in the world's corporate offices. Not really a problem, especially if you have a car. We had a lovely balcony room with a bit of a Biscayne Bay view. The tv that was in the mirror in the bathroom was over the top ... but i'm sure some people love it!

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown location. $25 cab ride to South Beach.”
Reviews.Author: joe812
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel over the recent President's day weekend. Our first choice would have been to stay on Miami Beach, but we were using Marriott reward points and were not able to redeem them at a waterfront property. The downtown location would be better suited for business travelers than leisure travelers. It was in the heart of downtown and there were several good restaurants within walking distance. It is a $25 cab ride to the closest beach in South Beach on the 600 block of Ocean Drive (beach was awesome). The hotel pool is on a 7th floor roof deck and only gets sun for limited hours during the day because of surrounding high rises. Rooms are in need of an update; they look a little tired. I see no difference between this "JW Marriott" and other "Marriott" hotels I have stayed at in the past. Ask for a #-02 room... they are end units that have two exterior walls with the 3rd wall being a stairwell... very quiet, no noise from neighbors. Also, the spa at the Viceroy down the street is a MUST!

Reviews.Title: “Worth the price”
Reviews.Author: SajoGreen
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Miami, and I am very glad I chose this hotel. The room was lively, with panoramic views. Everything was spotless and comfortable. There are multiple restaurants on site, but they are a little pricey, as is the room service. The location was just what I was looking for downtown. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Quiet on Weekends”
Reviews.Author: charchar399
Reviews.Content: First of all, this is a very nice hotel. Clean, new, well-maintained, nice furnishings and fixtures. The fitness center was small-ish but well-equipped and perfectly serviceable assuming not more than 6 people are working out. The bed is heaven, so comfortable! Things I wish I knew before I went: they provide a very lousy, travel-sized hair dryer, you know, the type that takes 45 minutes to dry your hair. Valet parking at $29 a day is expensive, slow, inefficient and rude. The downtown Miami location is quiet for the weekend. The Starbucks I was so excited to go to downstairs was closed on the weekend, however a cute French bakery across the street had tasty coffee. This is clearly a business hotel. That said, with a car you are very close to anywhere you want to be, only about 1 mile south of the America Airlines Arena area. There are also nice views of Key Biscayne.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Mo_Nique212
Reviews.Content: My friends and i went to miami for new years, we wanted to be near miami beach, and away from the south beach traffic. We stayed at this hotel, and the service was wonderful. The staff showed such hospitality, and the rooms were so comfortable, and clean. I would go back in a second!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a fun weekend”
Reviews.Author: Distinctivetraveller
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went there and other than the staff receiving cars that are not too friendly, the lady at the checkin was very friendly and recommended a great Argentinian restaurant walking distance that we thoroughly enjoyed. We had a great suite that truly was worth it. We liked the fact that when we entered the room, they had put beautiful soft music for us. The closet needs a bit of styling, but we also enjoyed watching the tv integrated inside the mirror...quite original. They also had a computer in our room which was a nice plus, unfortunately the bellboy was going to send someone up that never showed up even though we followed up on the phone, so we switched it off since we really werent going to use it but for a couple of minutes. These are nice extras for rooms.

Reviews.Title: “A favourite of ours.”
Reviews.Author: ADRUK
Reviews.Content: Grat place to stay in Miami. great big bedroom. Pools, restaurants, kids play areas and freindly staff. Had a slight issue with the first room we were shown to, but was soon remedied. Lots of smiles all round.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: vmichel54
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel is a nice business style hotel, it is not the usual quality of a JW Marriott. When we arrived at 11 AM the front desk was kind enough to give us keys to a room. When we got to the room, we discovered that it had a horrific odor. I called the front desk and they sent a bellman to our room. The bellman was shocked by the horrible odor and called the front desk saying it was definitely necessary for us to move. The front desk said they didn't have another room of the same type but if I wanted to pay $50 more, we could have a concierge room. After a lengthy conversation with the front desk representative, I finally asked to talk to a manager. The manager said it was their policy not to give people concierge rooms without the $50 and stood his ground. I told him I was shocked that even though the smell was their responsibility, he asked us to pay for a different room. I told the manager I was apalled by his customer service and somehow he found another room right away. Although the manager never apologized for the smell, nor for our having to take time to deal with the issue, when we arrived at the room, we discovered he had given us the Executive Suite. It was clear the suite wasn't used much because there were no shampoo or other amenities in the room and I had to track down housekeeping to ask for shampoo, nonetheless we were grateful for the room. I rated the customer service low because, even though we did get a nicer room, I would have preferred nice customer service. The rest of the hotel was pretty average, definitely not the usual JW Marriott quality.

Reviews.Title: “Simple Luxury at its best”
Reviews.Author: tripholic
Reviews.Content: You can not go wrong with this hotel. Prime downtown location with solid amneties and professional staff. Was booked at new JW Marquis but it did not open in time, so got placed here. They were very accomidating(conciere level). Food great and surprisingly inexpensive for such a high end hotel. TV in the bathroom mirror is a must see. Prompt service in valet service and the $32 a day reminds me of Chicago. Check out Inca res(peruvian) if you get a chance. Overall, very nice stay and I would definately go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Great service at a great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: zsmith77
Reviews.Content: My wife and stayed at this hotel October 9 through the 12th. I've read some earlier reviews that described indifferrent service. Our experience was nothing like that. I appreciate politeness and every staff member we dealt with was exceptionally pleasant. From the person who checked us in, to the housekeeping staff and the valet. In my experience folks in Miami can be somewhat brusque, I didn't experience that here. The staff was very helpful in arranging in room massages for Sunday morning. The rooms are tastefully decorated. Photos uploaded by previous reviewers are representative of the accomodations we had. Upon check-in we were given a corner room on the 19th floor that we really enjoyed. The room wasn't huge, but it was very comfortable and quiet. The hotel is located in the financial center of Miami. Consequently, I'd say it caters to a business clientele. But vacationers shouldn't feel out of place. There are numerous dinning options within walking distance (depending on the heat/humidity and your comfort level with it). Ranging from the chain, Gordon Biersch, Morton's to the ethnic, Colombian perros at "La Moon". Mary Brickell Village is within walking distance and it offers some nightlife. Tobacco Road (oldest bar in Miami) isn't far. If you're looking for South Beach frenzy you won't find that here. The neighborhood will be very quiet in the evenings. Other observations: The fitness room was above average. Parking costs $25.00, comparable to other hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “great looking hotel, good facilities, but not extraordinary”
Reviews.Author: TRAXUK
Reviews.Content: reasonable location downtown - near lots of good restaurants. the hotel is well kept and provides pretty good facilities. it is a bit dated in places, but still clean. nothing extraordinary to report, but at the same time, nothing bad to say either.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: robundle
Reviews.Content: This is a super nice hotel. The stainless steel pool is beautiful. The rooms are extremely comfortable and the bathrooms are luxurious. The restaurant service is very good. My only complaint is that my husband and I went swimming at the pool around 5:30 pm, and we wanted to use one of the tents set up in the pool area. But they were both in a state of disarray. They had left over food in them that looked like it had been setting out for a long time from previous guests, including fried onion rings. Yuck. That was a bit of a turn off, but other than that, this place was great.

Reviews.Title: “First Time at this Hotel, and I am Now a Fan”
Reviews.Author: PAQ
Reviews.Content: I tend to stay at luxury hotels. I really enjoyed this hotel for 1 night. Quiet on 18th floor, pool was large, weight room acceptable, free wi-fi and free business lounge with printer was key. 40" HDTV was really nice. Will stay here again whenever have early meeting on Brickell Avenue. Nicely appointed room and public spaces too. Extremely helpful front desk and concierge. Valet was efficient even at $29 overnight.

Reviews.Title: “Great but expensive”
Reviews.Author: innerewut
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great service but not cheap either. We visited the hotel in December 2009 and stayed for 2 nights. A very elegant business hotel with good food. The location is not the best as it is in downtown Miami which is not the nicest place to be as a tourist. Not much to do or see after 7pm. But if you are looking for a great business hotel with a business center in downtown and price is not an issue, you found your place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: mrswlsjr
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the JW Marriott for 4 days and we had a great time. The room was very clean and the staff was excellent. The hotel amenities were wonderful. You will not go wrong by choosing this hotel. We have plans to stay there again later on this year. Excellent hotel....

Reviews.Title: “Nice place!”
Reviews.Author: tourismspecialist88
Reviews.Content: Just stayed one night. Was fortunate to get a corner room with a water view, and the room and view were very agreeable! I didn't have any meals, nor did I have enough time to try out the facilities in general, so my review is based primarily on one night in the room. Bed was very comfortable and linens were excellent. My complaints are relatively minor, but for a hotel at this level, one expects top-notch. - As a Marriott member, I requested foam pillows, but didn't get them - the wireless, though free (bravo, about time hotels quit gouging travelers for wireless!), but it took an unreasonable half hour just to get the damn thing to work! I was not alone, as it took my colleague even longer, so it doesn't seem to be limited to my computer challenges - the in room coffee was lousy, and can't they offer real coffee mugs?? Overall, the location for our needs was just fine - had a nice lunch next door at the Gordon Biersch, and got coffee in the morning from Starbucks. I'd be happy to stay here again if I was coming for business nearby, but probably wouldn't stay if I was in MIA as a tourist.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: mthubert
Reviews.Content: My wife had a conference at this hotel so I tagged along with our 2 year old. The room was nice and clean and the staff was nice. You really have no option but to use the valet parking since there is no parking anywhere around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Marriott”
Reviews.Author: msbrown76
Reviews.Content: I visit Miami, mainly South Beach, at least once a year. This time we decided to stay away from the beach so we could enjoy downtown Miami a little more. The JW Marriott was perfect. It seems to be in a banking district, which was fine with us, because it was nice and quiet at night. When we first arrived at the hotel, I was very pleased with what I saw. However, no one helped us with our bags when we pulled up, which was quite a surprise. The lobby of the hotel is very nicely decorated and the front desk staff was very inviting. Our room was perfect. I loved the bathroom, flat screen and computer with free internet access. The pool, spa and fitness center were all great. My only complaint, which isnâ€™t really that bad, is that there was no place for us to store water or other beverages. The refrigerator was set up like a vending machine, so there was no room to put anything else. We did not get to go to any of the restaurants or lounges in the hotel, because we wanted to explore the city. The front desk staff referred us to a local Cuban restaurant called Versailles, which was wonderful. I thought it would be a stuffy, fancy place, but it was quite the opposite, and the food was great. Thereâ€™s also a Gordon Biersch and Mortonâ€™s right across the street from the hotel for a good, quick meal. Overall, my stay at the Marriott was great, and I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: apperley17
Reviews.Content: We tagged a few nights in Miami after a cruise in the Caribbean. Whilst we were not overly impressed with Miami itself, this hotel was lovely. Very clean, air conditioned, big rooms, great bathroom with big sunken bath, internet access, huge TV. Everything you need. There were plenty of people on reception willing to point us in the right direction for trips, food and shops etc (for a tip, of course!) Unfortunately, it was in a fairly built up area and we couldn't see the sea from our room (although I understand that there are rooms with sea views). It was a bit of a walk to the nearest shops etc but taxis were easy to come by and there was always the overground rail (about a 10 minute walk to the nearest station) Overall, a nice place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “My sister booked a room for my wife and I...”
Reviews.Author: sbraunstein
Reviews.Content: My sister booked a room for my wife and I at the JW Marriott Miami. We were to stay 2 nights 4/15 and 4/23 at the start and the end of our honeymoon. I called to find out if our reservations were in their system. I found out that they had the reservation for 4/15 but not 4/23. When I spoke with the reservation staff I ended up being blatantly hung up on. This morning I found out that they billed my credit card, when the room was prepayed. I think perhaps the staff needs more training, or at least an attitude adjustment. I have stayed at several JW, as well as Marriotts and have always had a very positive experience. After this, I'm not sure that any of Marriott's brands would be in my top 3 choices to stay at. I was very dissapointed with the staff at this one.

Reviews.Title: “Treated us right!”
Reviews.Author: ZachaRyan
Reviews.Content: I was lucky enough to get the JW Marriott at well before market rate on Priceline a couple of months before we stayed there. Soon after our bid was accepted, I confirmed I would get a non-smoking king. When I called to reconfirm a few hours in advance, right beofre we boarded our flight to Miami, the person on the other end of the phone said they could guarantee nonsmoking but not the king. When we got there, they upgraded us to the where they had a remaining king -- Room 2100 -- the "Boardroom Suite," which, believe it or not, actually has a smaller-than-normal sized bedroom with a king -- and an entire boardroom with a huge table in an adjoining room, with a view of the water. With the upgrade, we also got access to the free breakfast and snacks in the concierge lounge on our level -- perfect as a prelude to our cruise the next day! Many thanks to the JW Marriott for helping make our 10th anniversary trip memorable!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for downtown stay”
Reviews.Author: cfischer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the JW for 9 days over Thanksgiving and were very pleased with our choice. If you want the beach it might not be the best hotel for you, but for a stay in the downtown area or if you are planning to rent a car and drive around South Florida it is great. I played the 'LNF' game and got an awesome rate of $88 per night, which didn't stop the hotel form upgrading us to a concierge level corner room! Check-in was a bit slow, but we arrived very late in the night. The room was furnished in modern decors and the bed was perfect. Everything was clean, modern (TV was kind of old) and working. Another highlight is the concierge lounge on the top floor which featured a good selection of hot and cold snacks in the evening as well a nice breakfast selection. The hotel lounge was even open on Thanksgiving evening and for the weekend they gave us free breakfast vouchers for the hotel restaurant. Overall we loved the hotel and the staff and we will definitely return to this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Most Excellent Adventure!”
Reviews.Author: Capette
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott two nights before our cruise on March 21, 2010. The hotel is very beautiful, clean and the staff are extremely friendly and helpful. Everyone always had a smile and they were always quick to offer help and suggestions on where to go and how to get there. We had a room on the same floor as the pool so we had our own private little balcony/deck area right outside of our patio doors. It was wonderful. I would highly recommend however you must know that the hotel is in a purely business area and there is not alot around it. We were able to walk to Bayside Market in about ten minutes or so. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Nice room...nice view...service a little frustrating, and where's the TV in the mirror?!?!?”
Reviews.Author: mwgoldstein
Reviews.Content: I'm finishing up a 6-night stay at the JW for business. I was told to stay here along with a few other co-workers for 2 reasons...1) it's less than a mile from the office I'd be working out of, and 2) you've got to see these TV's they have built into the bathroom mirrors! Well, the rooms are very nice. Very big and roomy. While I couldn't get a view toward the water, I was given an end room with two walls of windows...very nice view of the downtown area beyond Brickell Avenue. So after checking in, I went to the bathroom to check out the novelty of a TV in the mirror. To me, it looked like a mirror. I asked someone at the front desk when I was there, and they told me that if you weren't in a suite, you had to be on the 19th floor or above (I was on 17) or in a suite to have the TVs in the mirror. A fellow coworker, who was on 19, was told you had to nbe on 21 or above. I was kind of bummed, but I'm not sure how you'd watch TV in the bathroom anyway...certainly not while using the toilet, which was on the same wall and separated by a partition. The room is comfortable. The flat screen in the main room is very nice...would've been better if they offered HD, but I don't know if anyone does that. The large desk chair was nice as well. While they do offer free wireless service, it was very unreliable...slow, failed to connect regularly, unsecure, and overall, worth about as much as it costs. Now, for $10/day, you can have secure wired service. The 'tech' maintenance guy wasn't much help in diagnosing what was wrong with the connection. The scene they set for you in the room (i.e., curtains all open, some type of classy music playing on the CD player in the room, etc.,) is a nice touch. Towels were clean, soft, thick, and big...best I can remember at a hotel. I always wondered why hotels don't use some form of fabric softener. If you can pick what type of pillow you want, why can't you pick whether your linens have been washed with a fabric softener. Anyway, these were really soft. One irk...I don't mind housekeeping coming in and straightening up every day; however, when they get anal to the point where they have to move your stuff in order to get the room to look exactly the same as it did when you check in, that really bugs me. If I move the yucky hair dryer (that I don't need) bag away from the hook on the back of the bathroom door b/c I need that hook for my hanging bathroom bag, I don't need the hairdryer back on the hook (on top of my stuff) the next day. And I definitely don't need all of my bathroom items pushed to the sides of the bathroom counter so they little bottle of this and that can be put back where they're supposed to be...like I said, just a little irk...but after fighting with these and many other types of things...and literally having to put the room back the way I want it each day for a few days in a row. I finally just started hanging the sign on the door each day so I wouldn't have to mess with it anymore. You're only a few blocks from the water, and within walking distance of around 20 restaurants, bars, nightclubs, etc. The concierge keeps a handly list of eateries in the area. We had a corporate rate of $220/night. Pretty good for that rater...I don't know if I could see paying $300-400/nt of my own money, but you never know.

Reviews.Title: “OK but not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: fberkeley
Reviews.Content: First the good: great location on Brickell Avenue if you want to be in this area of Miami. Nearby hotels include the fabulous Mandarin Oriental, Four Seasons and Conrad Miami. Front Desk staff pleasant and efficient. Beds very comfortable. Now the not-so-good, and in combination these items make the J W Marriott just not worth the $359+ rate: stains on bedroom carpet and on bathroom throw rug; limited cable TV selection (just 37 channels - no MSNBC, etc.); no newspapers; no turndown (even though it is listed in the Guest Services Directory), no bathrobes; speed dial buttons on phone not programmed; Room Service trays/dishes left in corridor all night; no one in Housekeeping seems to speak even rudimentary English. The main restaurant is closed on Monday night (isn't Monday a business travel day?) Breakfast buffet an outright rip-off at $23.95++. A la carte oatmeal served in a tiny bowl the size of a coffee cup. Had to (literally) beg for check in Drake's Bar even though there were no other customers in room. There are too many good hotels in Miami; would not return to this one at half the price.

Reviews.Title: “5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: i5405
Reviews.Content: Our party had 3 rooms for pre-cruise. We all were very happy. No complaints. It's expensive but most hotels in Miami are.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice for a Downtown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mowfam
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable room with a very convenient pool and fitness area. The room had a high humidity odor to it but the furnishings were great as was the free internet. Compared to the Conrad Miami one block over, this place was easy to get around and the staff very friendly. I particularly enjoyed the Starbucks with the local bakery next door as well as the other local eateries across the street. I'm not crazy about the downtown location but it was a good value.

Reviews.Title: “smelly room, otherwise ok”
Reviews.Author: dorinser
Reviews.Content: Stayed here early January. room was smelly (because of too much humidity) and windows had drops of water all over them (from condensation). Otherwise a nice room, comfortable (great beds), with free internet access and PC in the room. Restaurant ok. Staff tried to make me pay 2 days of valet parking for one night, but gave up finally.

Reviews.Title: “OK but not great”
Reviews.Author: Traveler20100
Reviews.Content: The good thing about this hotel is location and the views. Also gym is pretty nice. The bad: -watch out for concert dates, unless you are part of the fan group, be prepared to weird crowds -Internet not free -business center not free -elevators are either out of service or look and smell like they are 100 years old -being a platinum member I didn't get an upgrade -consierge is crowded so getting food/drinks is problematic -parking is expensive and very tight( you will know what I mean if you bring a car) -overall quality of service is below average when comes to staff with some exceptions -cleaning people skipped our room a couple of times

Reviews.Title: “Pleasnat Stay with minor glitches”
Reviews.Author: drdeepakgoyal
Reviews.Content: I stayed in above hotel with a friend for 6 nights. Standard International rooms with all standard facilities available. Reception attendant was also very helpful and so were porters. We could not find any major flaw except few. 1. Could not find 24 hour restaurant at JW Marriott!! However room service was 24 hours. 2. Internet connectivity in room thru wired LAN had persistent problem, but staff was efficient enough to come all the time and repair it. 3. Gym was a bad experience as no one was present at gym. Even on calling help button, some one keep on replying that he will be thre in 5 min. Even after calling 5 times in 30 min, no one came. finally has to leave without doing a workout. Overall, a good place to stay. It is very close to Center of city but far away from Beach.

Reviews.Title: “verdadero costumer care”
Reviews.Author: Jrivera1953
Reviews.Content: i love this hotel since i arrived the clerk was very kind the bel boy was very helpful about information of the hotel and my room allway was very clean and in order

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in financial district”
Reviews.Author: NixNix
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights as a pre-cruise stay. Although financial district a bit of a taxi ride to South Beach, the area is very clean and modern. Take a walk to the waters edge just a few steps from hotel, it's lovely. Free internet in rooms, great TV, free bottled water, great view, comfortable beds, spotlessly clean,supermarket close by.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay. Upgraded in a suite”
Reviews.Author: KarlD40
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at this JW Marriott. Our suite was wonderful with 2 Plasma screens and a large balcony with sea view.... The concierge lounge is very nice. You can enjoy nice appetizers, beer and wine... The breakfast is also very nice! Very good service. The pool is cool. Very handy is the free of charge metro line is Miami Downtown.

Reviews.Title: “I would like to stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: LakersFan
Reviews.Content: October 22, 2009 â€“ I had the opportunity to spend one night at the JW Marriott Hotel in Miami Florida while on business in the area. I wish that I could have stayed a day or two longer! Service at the JW was excellent! Every single hotel associate went out of their way to offer a pleasant greeting. The hotel seemed very friendly. Checking in, I received room #2212, which is on the 22nd floor, also designated the â€œPresidential Floor.â€� Getting off of the elevator there is a round presidential seal on the wall and both the Presidential and Vice-Presidential suites are on this floor. My room reservation was made by a colleague and I received a room with two queen-size beds instead of a king, but it was fine with me. The room was very comfortable in every respect. The air conditioning was quiet and effective and did not blow directly on me when in bed or working at the desk. Lighting in the room was good. One of the features I liked best about my room was the espresso machine. I donâ€™t know if all the rooms have espresso machines, but it was a treat for me. I made decaf the evening I arrived and used up the four packs of regular the next morning. The desk had a PC on it, but I travel with my laptop so I did not use it. Because the hotel charges for high speed internet, I used my T-Mobile wireless connection so I cannot comment on the speed or reliability of the hotelâ€™s internet service. My room had a very large flat screen TV mounted to the wall. Only standard definition programming was available. The bathroom was very nice, with a glassed-in combination tub and shower. This was the first JW Marriott that I have stayed in where there was not a separate shower. The bath amenities seemed to be high quality. The towels were thick and very absorbent. Lighting was OK for me, but my wife would probably have said it was not bright enough. There was a TV in the bathroom, but it showed through the mirror so it was very dim, especially when the both lights were on. Water pressure was high and hot water flowed immediately. There was a large leather arm chair between one of the beds and windows. It was very comfortable. There being no ottoman, I used the edge of the bed. Because the room had two queen-size beds, there was not room for an ottoman or a coffee table. My room, #2212 faced east and had a partial view of Biscayne Bay and Miami Beach in the distance. I say partial, because there were several tall buildings between the hotel and bay. However, the view was good from my 22nd floor room. The one queen-size bed that I used was very comfortable. The bedding was high quality and the pillows smelled fresh. On the night stand between the two beds was a combination CD player and clock radio. I tried for about five minutes to figure out how to set the alarm, but finally gave up and asked for a wake-up call. The wake-up call was by a person, not a machine. The only place near the beds to plug my cell phone charger in was behind the night stand, a minor inconvenience. My colleague and I arrived just before the concierge lounge closed, but were in time for desert. There were several selections including individual chocolate cake that must likely boasted over 1,000 calories. It was very good! The buffet breakfast in the lounge offered scrambled eggs and bacon as well as a wide assortment of fruit, breads, and juices. The coffee was excellent and the concierge even offered to brew espresso for guests. I visited the spa, but only to take a few photos of the exercise room. The exercise room overlooks the outdoor swimming pool. The equipment looked very new. Exercise towels and water were set out. The treadmills and stationary bikes faced windows that looked out onto the pool area. There was an adjoining room with weight equipment and free weights. The outdoor pool was deserted when I looked, but it looked inviting. We used valet parking and calling down before I left my room; the rental car was waiting for us. The $27 parking fee is high, but typical of parking charges downtown in just about any major city. The JW Marriott was very comfortable, the service was excellent and I can recommend it as a hotel that I would like to return to in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel if traveling to banking district”
Reviews.Author: FlyonTime
Reviews.Content: I just wrapped up a 4-night stay at the JW Marriott in Miami. Overall I had a nice stay and would stay here again in the future. The hotel staff was friendly and accommodating. The location is ideal if you are traveling to the banking district (I was) but not so ideal for beach travelers. As other reviewers mention a couple of nice restaurants are located near the hotel but the immediate vicinity around the hotel feels a little â€œquietâ€� in the evenings. You can take a 10 minute walk to the Mary Brickell area which is a more lively area with restaurants and shops or cab it to South Beach. The room and bathroom were both spacious and clean. The fitness center at the hotel is very nice for a hotel and had a large selection of exercise equipment. The room I stayed in (7th floor) had a large balcony with a city view which was a nice bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: amoljo
Reviews.Content: Month of stay - March 2009 Reviewer - 105584345 The hotel is conveniently located in the banking district and it makes sense to stay there if your office is nearby. The rooms are very comfortable and convenient with enough space to work in the room if required. The complimentary internet connection is helpful to catch up on work, if required. Good hotel to stay in if you are a business traveller as the hotel staff is very efficient and are willing to go the extra mile to help you. The area gets deserted in the evenings but there are a few good restaurants to hang about in the Brickell Village which is only a 7-8 minutes walk from the hotel

Reviews.Title: “This is not a Five Star hotel”
Reviews.Author: dannymcl
Reviews.Content: Staying here for the second night but already, I am clear this is not a five star hotel. First impressions not good - pulling up in the car, I learn that it is valet parking only at $27 per night - that's getting close to how much it cost to rent the car per day. As it was a Saturday night, there were loads of white clad valet parkers standing around - that just makes me hassled. I want to park my own car, get the stuff I need and take my time. I asked about alternative local public parking, but none of the white clad gentlemen understood the term "public parking" - it took four guys to consult before they knew what I was talking about. That ain't Five Star hotel service either. The hotel is in Downtown which looks pretty dead at the weekend and it is sorrounded by much taller apartment blocks and offices From my SW facing corner room there is a very small glimpse of the sea.. The room feels small compared to the Singapore Fairmont that I just got back from.Now that is a proper Five Star hotel and is the benchmark I am using to rate this place. Furniture is quite tired looking, big lumps of brown wood placed so as to block access to the window blinds and electrical sockets. Closing the blinds at night is a real pain and I tripped over a stupidly placed magazine rack which has seen better days and looks like plenty of other people have tripped over it too. There is no central control of lighting, so hitting the bed and leaving the light on means you have to get up again. Don't come to this hotel if you want to stay in touch with international TV news channels - no BBC World? But loads of the usual religious channels in the morning and those selling channels. Perhaps the line up will improve as the working week begins. Wireless access works well here on the 17th floor and is free. There is a mini Wyse "Winterm" on the desktop but I have not used it. It has two USB ports but not sure if you could plug a card reader or other USB peripherals into it. There is also wired internet access but it costs $9.99 per day. A strange pricing structure - if you don't have wireless on your laptop you are in trouble. The hotel seems to be participating in this foolish "pillow arms race", there are seven pillows on my bed at present - which is ridiculous. Someone need to let them know loads of pillows does not a "Five Star hotel make". Other room amenities - mini bar fridge with minimal space to put your own stuff - just squeezed a one pint bottle of fresh milk and some chocolate in. Coffee maker in a drawer but only plastic cups supplied - that definitely downrates this place. There are wine glasses and tumblers for drinks but plastic cups for tea or coffee. A quick call to housekeeping did sort that one out. Large wall mounted LCD TV but positioned badly for watching if you are sitting working at desk in room. At the desk in the room, there is only one power outlet built into the lamp. Another is hidden behind the desk and is both a stretch and not practical to plug in many AC adapters. My tip, always bring a multi-way socket outlet for these situations. Breakfast was in another tired looking room - a poor selection - they passed my porride and bacon test - both available and tasty, but croissants poor, orange juice had to be requested - not available on buffet (a first for me). Room seemed lifeless - no buzz even if it was a Sunday morning. Overall, the US seems to do budget hotels really well, I have virtually always been satisfied with a range of hotels from a really cheap Knight's Inn in Pennsylvania through excellent Holiday Inn Expresses and recently a Candlewood Suites even Marriott Courtyards, but proper Five Star service seems to be sub-standard when compared with the best European or Asian hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay at the JW Marriott”
Reviews.Author: KimCT
Reviews.Content: We had a late flight and arrived at the Hotel close to midnight. Check-in was friendly and quick. We were given a concierge level room (nice surprise). The room was large, clean and comfortable. Great city view. The complimentary breakfast was very good with a nice sitting area to enjoy the morning paper. Nice selection of papers as well. Staff was quite attentive to us. We only stayed one night pre-cruise and did not get to enjoy all of the amenities of the Hotel. The Hotel is located in the Miami business district so it can be a challenge to get a cab on a Sunday morning. The Staff was able to get us a cab in 5 minutes. This Hotel is very convenient to the Cruise Terminal, a short cab ride away. Highly recommend the JW Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Below par in some respects, but I'd come again”
Reviews.Author: Traveler0429
Reviews.Content: I am presently staying at the JW Marriott, finishing up a one week visit. It is below par in some respects, but for what I am looking for, I would stay again. Here are downsides: 1. Housekeeping is not great. Our suite was not vacuumed prior to arrival six days ago and has not been vacuumed since. 2. The worse thing for me is that it is impossible 99 percent of the time to send emails. My partner and I have both had this problem using both our laptops as well as the computer provided by the hotel. Tech staff spent a couple of hours our first day here trying to fix it but did not. If I were staying here on business, this would have been more of a problem than it has been. I have been able to use my blackberry to send urgent emails to my staff, but this is really unacceptable at these rates. Here are upsides: 1. It is very close to nice dining: Gordon Biersch next door and Morton's across the street. 2. Room service food has also been delicious, and the chef has prepared a special order meal for me twice (due to dietary needs). 3. Because we are in a suite, we have access to the concierge lounge, which has been wonderful: great comp breakfast, sodas/water throughout the day, major newsapers, etc. So, I would stay again, but the internet problems and housekeeping are really unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Usual high standard”
Reviews.Author: Jctee
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the JW Marriott for one night (a Saturday) after flying in from London. Service was good and friendly. The bedroom and bathroom were of a good size and were very clean. The bed was very comfortable. I thought the dining choices for dinner were limited for a hotel of this calbre - it was either the sports bar/cafe or the gastronomic restaurant (which seemed rather "precious" and was empty). Something in between would have been nice. My only complaint - and this was not the hotel's fault - was that I was bothered by noise from a party somewhere in the vicinity - music and people yelling until around 9:00am on the Sunday morning. Well, I guess that is to be expected in Miami on a Saturday night, but I had hoped to avoid this by staying away from the beach. After a long flight I was looking for peace and quiet and a good night's sleep. I appreciated the computer in the bedroom with free internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced & Over-rated”
Reviews.Author: Becks08
Reviews.Content: I disagree with most of the recent reviews. My husband & I had reservations for 2 nights. We left after the first night and went to another upscale hotel nearby. The valet area was very crowded and slow. The front desk staff told us at check in that the hotel was "fully committed" and we could not be upgraded (even if we paid extra for a better room). The place was a ghost town, and I can't figure out how it could have been sold out. The lobby and bar area were completely empty. They put us on the 10th floor overlooking the pool, which was not a big deal, though we would have preferred a view. The hallway leading to our room smelled old and musty, and the carpet was ancient. Our room was a standard king, nothing special aside from the flat screen in the wall and the computer. The Wi-fi (which was free) was slow at best. It was pointless to even try to connect to my laptop wirelessly, and had to use the DSL cable. The tv volume control was set not to turn up any louder than "15" on the control. our alarm clock woke us at 7 am, though we didn't set it. The wall paper was peeling off the bathroom wall. The bed was hard, and not as plush as other JW's or even Marriott's. The guest room carpeting was old, stained and I didn't want to walk on it without my shoes! I called the front desk at 11pm and told them we would be checking out in the morning and not staying 2 nights as planned. They did not ask why. Upon checkout, I told the clerk of the above issues, and he simply said he was sorry I felt that way. We're Marriott Reward members and often stay with Marriott, but this was nothing special. It's hard to imagine they stamped the JW name on it. There are too many other places nearby that deserve the high price!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: Intrepid1
Reviews.Content: Three adults spent one night, pre-New Years cruise, at this hotel and we were very satisfied with the experience. Originally booked a weekend concierge rate room for 26 December on the Marriott.com site. When that rate was reduced I was able to change and take advantage of the reduction. Check in was fast as was bell service bag delivery to the room. Room had two double beds with the usual expected Marriott amenities. Comfortable beds, flat screen TV, and enough space for some work, internet access fast, good housekeeping. Hotel seemed to be fairly full but no noise heard from other rooms or from hallways. Concierge lounge served fairly extensive breakfast which was well-managed and attended to by room attendants. Used valet parking for my rental car and the retrieve service was excellent and very prompt regardless of the time of day or night, very late and very early included. The hotel certainly lived up to expectations and I would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Consistantly brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Roombaguy
Reviews.Content: After a few stays, this hotel is consistantly brilliant. Staff is friendly and always helpful. Location is great for business travelors to the financial district.

Reviews.Title: “Usual 5 star treatment from Marriott”
Reviews.Author: michiruo
Reviews.Content: JW Marriott has always been known to be a business and 5 star hotel. Comfort, service and hotel amentities definitely delivers. Location is ok but if you want to be near the beach, probably not. Walking distance to restaurants like Morton, porcao. Valet per night costs about US$30. Budget traveller will find that hotel price is high. If you do not have restricted budget, definitely try this.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: RMacari
Reviews.Content: Located at Brickel Avenue the JW Mariott was my best choice to stay so far. Great staff, excellent location and a comfortable room make this hotel the best choice in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal, Great Service, All-around Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: Navy_Lady
Reviews.Content: I'm actually a die-hard Hilton Honors fan; however, the rate at Marriott was better than the Conrad in Miami so I went ahead and tried it. Let me first tell you that this hotel is one of the best I've experienced. Clean, large, well equipped room. Top-of-the-line amenities (soap, lotion, mouthwash, shampoo, conditioner, shower gel); free bottled water and coffee/tea service; 42" plasma wall-mounted TV; FREE internet in the room; awesome views of the city; comfy but firm bed with crisp white smooth linens and lots of pillows; great room service ... really very pleasant stay! Within two blocks, there is access to the free metro mover which takes you pretty much every where you'd like to go. Went from the downtown/Brickell area to the port area to the shopping at Bayside. Very convenient, FREE, and lots of bang for the buck (LOL! shopping queen here). Right next door to Gordon Biersch which was very nice to have a variety of cold beers and then be able to walk back across the street to the JW Marriott. Also across the street from Morton's Steakhouse, if that's what you're into (I'm not, since I'd much rather BBQ my own ranch-raised steers than pay for their overpriced a la carte steak dinners). Last, I do have one suggestion for the JW Marriott folks ... you are missing a TREMENDOUS opportunity for some really great PR with those silly newspaper holders...you know the ones that hang over the door, with your hotel name on the front, and a little strip of fabric holding the newspaper inside. Well, spend a few more cents and make it a bag with a solid bottom, and I'll bet folks will take them home/traveling with them to tote items around. What a great way to get publicity and get your name throughout the airports, with very little cost or modification of what you're doing now. And the little tote could turn up around the world, given the business travelers and cruise-line hoppers that come thru your hotel daily. Just a thought!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Great Staff, Handy Location”
Reviews.Author: timjarrett
Reviews.Content: We were a bit dubious about the downtown location of the hotel before we got there, but in the end were extremely happy with our choice. The staff in all areas of the hotel were friendly and more than helpful. Valet parking is compulsory and is charged for, but the service is really quick and the car was always ready for us within a couple of minutes. Our room had a great view, and was really well equipped, with the best TV I've seen in a hotel in a long time. The free wi-fi was useful, but the room was also equipped with a thin client internet terminal which was an unusual but very welcome touch. All in all, I'd highly recommend the JW Marriott Miami as a great location for exploring the City. Key Biscayne is about five minutes away along Brickell with some fantastic beaches, and the American Airlines Arena, Children's museum and Miami Beach are all just a short drive away.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Business Downtown Location”
Reviews.Author: Mroth
Reviews.Content: Very Nice Hotel ....Nice Amenitities.......Very Good Business Hotel.....but if you are looking to live the fun life......it is not that type

Reviews.Title: “First class”
Reviews.Author: JW37
Reviews.Content: After checking in and out of a terrible hotel in a matter of minutes, I called Marriott and booked a room here. First class hotel all the way. The staff was friendly, check-in quick & efficient and the room warm, large and well appointed with large flat panel tv, internet and decent bathroom. Thank you Marriott for turning a bad night in to a wonderful night. Would absolutely stay again. In financial district so not the place to stay if you're trying to do the beach. The views from the Biscayne Bay Marriott are incredible but the rooms are nicer here.

Reviews.Title: “First Class”
Reviews.Author: Sicall
